metadata.title: CVE-2018-14055 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
ZNC before 1.7.1-rc1 does not properly validate untrusted lines coming fromthe network, allowing a non-admin user to escalate his privilege and injectrogue values into znc.conf.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

znc - 1.2-3ubuntu0.1
znc-perl - 1.2-3ubuntu0.1
znc-python - 1.2-3ubuntu0.1
znc-tcl - 1.2-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: znc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-3ubuntu0.1').
